cyclone.name: DELTA
cyclone.current_location: about 160 miles south of Cameron, Louisiana
cyclone.trajectory: Moving north this morning and expected to turn north-northeast, tracking toward the southwest-central Louisiana coast and then inland across central Louisiana toward Mississippi Valley

port.name: Port of Greater Baton Rouge, LA

weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning from High Island TX to Morgan City LA; Tropical Storm Warning west of High Island to Sargent TX and east of Morgan City LA to the mouth of the Pearl River including New Orleans, Lake Pontchartrain and Lake Maurepas
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from High Island TX eastward to the Mississippi–Alabama border, with greatest impacts expected along the Louisiana coast
weather_observation.wind: Likely tropical-storm-force winds (39–57 mph) with a 17 % chance of reaching 50-kt (58 mph) sustained; gusts could be higher as the center passes west of Baton Rouge Friday evening.
weather_observation.storm_surge: No direct coastal surge at the port’s inland location, but tides and river levels on the lower Mississippi may rise modestly.
weather_observation.rainfall: 5–10 inches of rain with locally up to 15 inches possible, producing flash, urban, and minor river flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes Friday afternoon–night; significant lightning in rainbands; possible short-notice river/current restrictions on the Mississippi River channel.
